page.title: 11Churches at Cattistock
page.content: The church of St. Peter and St. Paul at Cattistock is of Saxon origin and was refashioned in 1857. The splendid tower, 8 bells, good baptistry and fine coloured windows are notable. The church, seating 200, depends on a team ministry of one rector and two vicars and has a roll of 70. Weekly services with organ (no choir) are attended by 10-15 persons. Sunday school. No marriages since 1983; more recently, only one baptism and nine funerals. "The Chimes" news sheet is distributed each month. Cattistock's Methodist Chapel, built in the 19th century, is no longer in use. The church of St Mary at Wraxall, with beginnings in the 12th century, was restored in the 19th century. Particularly small, the church is attended by 8-20 persons.
